steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . You can either find this grey gear icon on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. You can also swipe down from the top of your screen to pull down the quick menu where you will find the gear icon. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Digital Wellbeing.
steps.content: Tap Digital Wellbeing . This menu option might appear differently depending on your phone's manufacturer.

steps.title: Tap the three vertical dots ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the three vertical dots ⋮ . It's the menu icon in the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's the only option in the menu.

steps.title: Tap Deny access to usage data.
steps.content: Tap Deny access to usage data . The feature will no longer collect or provide you with data about your phone usage patterns and habits, and any data it has already collected will be deleted within 24 hours.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This will redirect you to a new menu where you can restrict which apps use data.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "Digital Wellbeing" to toggle it off .
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "Digital Wellbeing" to toggle it off . If the switch is pointing to the right and grey, the feature is disabled. If you go back to the Digital Wellbeing menu, you'll notice that everything is blank, including your screen time goal, app timers, driving monitor, walking monitor, and volume monitor.
